t: Isaiah 24
Impending Judgment on the Earth
Behold,*pn the Lord*s makes the earth empty and makes it waste, Distorts*ld its surface And*ld scatters abroad its inhabitants.

And*ld it shall be: As*ld with the people, so with the priest; As*ld with the servant, so with his master; As*ld with the maid, so with her mistress; As*ld with the buyer, so with the seller; As*ld with the lender, so with the borrower; As*ld with the creditor, so with the debtor.
The*ld land shall be entirely emptied and utterly plundered, For*ld the Lord*s has spoken this word.
The*ln earth mourns and*i fades away, The*ld world languishes and*i fades away; The*ld haughty people of the earth languish.
The*ld earth is also defiled under its inhabitants, Because*ld they have transgressed the laws, Changed*ld the ordinance, Broken*ld the everlasting covenant.
Therefore*ld the curse has devoured the earth, And*ld those who dwell in it are desolate. Therefore*ld the inhabitants of the earth are burned, And*ld few men are*i left.
The*ln new wine fails, the vine languishes, All*ld the merry-hearted sigh.
The*ld mirth of the tambourine ceases, The*ld noise of the jubilant ends, The*ld joy of the harp ceases.
They*ld shall not drink wine with a song; Strong*ld drink is bitter to those who drink it.
The*ld city of confusion is broken down; Every*ld house is shut up, so that none may go in.
There*ild is*i a cry for wine in the streets, All*ld joy is darkened, The*ld mirth of the land is gone.
In*ld the city desolation is left, And*ld the gate is stricken with destruction.
When*ld it shall be thus in the midst of the land among the people, It*ild shall*i be*i like the shaking of an olive tree, Like*ld the gleaning of grapes when the vintage is done.
They*ln shall lift up their voice, they shall sing; For*ld the majesty of the Lord*s They*ld shall cry aloud from the sea.
Therefore*ld glorify the Lord*s in the dawning light, The*ld name of the Lord*s God of Israel in the coastlands of the sea.

From*ld the ends of the earth we have heard songs: “Glory*ld to the righteous!” But*ld I said, “I am ruined, ruined! Woe*ld to me! The*ld treacherous dealers have dealt treacherously, Indeed,*ld the treacherous dealers have dealt very treacherously.”
Fear*ln and the pit and the snare Are*ild upon you, O inhabitant of the earth.

And*ld it shall be That*ild he who flees from the noise of the fear Shall*ld fall into the pit, And*ld he who comes up from the midst of the pit Shall*ld be caught in the snare; For*ld the windows from on high are open, And*ld the foundations of the earth are shaken.
The*ln earth is violently broken, The*ld earth is split open, The*ld earth is shaken exceedingly.
The*ld earth shall reel to and fro like a drunkard, And*ld shall totter like a hut; Its*ld transgression shall be heavy upon it, And*ld it will fall, and not rise again.
It*ln shall come to pass in that day That*ild the Lord*s will punish on high the host of exalted ones, And*ld on the earth the kings of the earth.
They*ld will be gathered together, As*ild prisoners are gathered in the pit, And*ld will be shut up in the prison; After*ld many days they will be punished.
Then*ld the moon will be disgraced And*ld the sun ashamed; For*ld the Lord*s of hosts will reign On*ld Mount Zion and in Jerusalem And*ld before His elders, gloriously.
